comments.body: You maybe should be able to use the brush to scrub the green oxidation off of the new copper block
Thatâ€™s cool!! Maybe use it on a bed to change the villager who uses itâ€™s job, also use it for disabling spawners, like turning them on and off
Would it be possible to also use the glow ink for a glow potion, or a new type of dye
It could be green colored that way we would have red, blue, yellow, and green torches in game.
it would be cool if the glow torch could give off a light of 18 to 20 instead of a regular tourches 15.
Yes.  Maybe the torch could be crafted with a new prismarine rod, which would be made from 2 prismarine and could also be used in a trident?

i really like this idea! I absolutely agree about strongholds being in inconvenient places and it would be such a great feature to make your own stronghold like room in your base, this feature could maybe also be used for some minigames. I now want this feature to be a thing!

Yes! This is a great idea! I want to flex on people with an end portal in my own house. I also agree that it should cost endstone as well to craft, so you have to find an end portal. My only concern for this is, at the moment, there is no way to break end portal blocks, so you would have to implement a way to break end portal blocks

Yes I 100% agree but if they donâ€™t choose it I hope it is as good of an idea ðŸ¤žthey do this tough it is a great idea and I travel if to the stronghold is a pain if it is a long way away like it is most of the time

I agree, I also realized that one of the skulk blocks has some yellow at the bottom that looks like endstone. This is why I think minecraft might be already planning to make this. So maybe combine the warden's heart with the skulk(endstone) looking block to make a end portal frame. Also it doesn't make sense that you would need something only found in the end to make the portal, because then how would the ancient builders of the end portal frame have made it.
Also breaking an end portal frame block wouldn't make it drop as an item.

I liked the idea at first, but I see three huge flaws with this;

  • In a way, that's what makes the Stronghold interesting in the first place. It's like the spawner rooms; what makes them interesting is that you have to travel there, build roads, and build around the structure.

  • End Portal Frames are indestructible, and for a reason! Having them be craftable with Endstone could mean that griefing yourself or others would ruin worlds. 

  • Perhaps farming Wardens (with Lava buckets or otherwise) will ruin their fear factor for many, while that fear is at the heart of their design and is the main reason they were added in the first place! Maybe Wardens shouldn't drop anything at all. Maybe it should instead guard loot found in structures.
Good idea and for the indestructible portal blocks. They could add a different version of it that is craftable and could be broken.
A bad idea considering an end portal block is unbreakable so a player could potentially misplace it and breaking the player's world.
Maybe you shouldnâ€™t need endstone cos thatâ€™s just mean :(. But you could replace it for obsidian, and the Wardenâ€™s heart could be used to make other items.

In my opinion the idea sounds good. But it would completely eliminate the scare factor of Wardens. I believe that Wardens should drop something. Not stuff used to craft End portal blocks but perhaps a special item used to craft weapons better then Netherite. Due to the fact that Netherite is extremely hard to get. For this would make players want to kill Wardens more. Or perhaps enchanted books and a new enchantment. I'm not against Warden drops but I think they should be "treasure items," or weapons that players can put to good use.

NO, The whole point of the End Portal Frame is that you have to find it. It will break the purpose if you can just craft it. And stop asking for Warden to drop something. Instead of making the warden drop something, why not put the thing you want inside the Loot Chest in The Deep Dark. That's the whole purpose of the Warden.
Maybe the heart could shoot a beam like the warden does

The thing is the warden is kind of useless. When it spawns people just run away and wait for it to despawn. It's existence seems kinda pointless. If it dropped something like this it would be good for two reasons. Number 1, Incentive. As it is now, there is no incentive to fight it, making this well designed boss, pointless to fight. Number 2, convenience. Keep in mind, this is an end-game item for after you have defeated the dragon and already found the portal. (maybe it should only spawn after the dragon is killed). You would still need to find the portal, but once you get enough warden hearts, you could craft your own. It is a pain to travel through the nether highway to get to the portal, so for convenience (AFTER DRAGON IS DEFEATED) It would be pretty useful. Sure the loot in the chests are pretty good, but there is still no point to the warden existing. One warden would only drop one heart, so you would need to fight twelve to get a portal. It seems challenging, but would add something the warden needs in minecraft. PLUS there is no current end game content in minecraft so I think this is a REALLY GOOD IDEA. Thank you for listening to my TED talk. goodbye.
Yes! And it would have some variation in color between the individual bricks within a block: one would be a bit of a darker brown, the next a lighter brown, the next one a bit more reddish?

I think thereâ€™s a lot of inconsistency in the types of blocks that are craftable with each stone type. For example: Quartz walls, granite/andesite/diorite bricks, etc. These variants would allow players to texture thier builds more. Although it shouldnâ€™t be overdone, then people have too many options.

Added it in my mod. I think it should have the same blast resistance as cobble, so it can withstand ghasts, as ghasts spawn there. It would also burn forever in soul fire, because it is made from soul sand.

Really agree. I've made some roads with soulsoils, for the benefit of soul speed. Only thing i dont like was they dosen't look pretty.. It would be great if there is more decorative soulsand variation block.
If it does extra damage, it should be more rare than usual to get.
Maybe it could change an existing flame enchantment into something like "Soul flame", which would incentivise upgrading the diamond tools first

I see where you are coming from, but once I had a shovel with fortune 3 I found I had more flint than I could handle.

 

Also with piercing if your arrow does not pass through it's max number of targets, it lands & can be recovered. This makes the ability to have almost infinite arrows possible.

Lastly there is already an option to possibly trade the Fletcher 10 gravel & an emerald for 10 flint.

 

I am on the fence whether gravel needs further use at this time. I know bamboo grows on gravel, so having a little for a farm gives it some purpose. I don't dabble often with concrete, but that seems like an already sound use for gravel.
We need this, why aren't people voting for this more?
I think the devs purposefully made it so that in early game you cannot obtain massive amounts of flint quickly. If you need arrows in large amounts just get some villagers.

I agree. Making arrows in survival mode is a painstaking process because of how hard it is to collect flint. Once you do acquire a few arrows, you are extremely reluctant to use them because you donâ€™t want to have to find more flint.
I think that smelting gravel into flint is a great idea. Another fix could be to receive a piece of flint from 100% or 50% of the gravel blocks you mine.
it should be called gilded netherite armor.
Maybe not 4 BLOCKS of it. I think surrounding it in ingots is enough
add all minecraft dungeons armor and weapons and blocks and items
Why not just make it by adding a single gold ingot in a smithing table? If all it does is stop Piglins from attacking you it shouldn't cost a wopping 4 blocks.
I think this is a bad idea, because it makes golden armor useless again. And the devs added Brutes because Bastions neede to be more challenging/late game structures
We want new weapon
This would mean you would mine 9x faster, without efficiency, or a conduit.
Way too OP
Mojang devs have said before that they do not want to add a way to break multiple blocks in survival. I doubt this can make it.
a way to make it less OP is to make the durability of the pickaxe go down 9x faster, and or make the speed of mining slightly slower.
I like it.
Totally agree, and also it could be a addition to thease beacons, maybe 50 blocks more of range? That would absolutely make them wotrh it.
good idea
Que pongan esto
aun que sea metan las sillas que nunca lo hicieron :(
Estoy total mente de acuerdo

• The armor value of these moccasins would not be as weak as leather but not as strong as diamond, I propose around the Iron level seeing as it does require a Netherite Ingot to craft but no diamonds.

Enchantments:

  • Mending
  • Unbreaking
  • Lava Walker
  • Lava walker would simply just extend the amount of time you could stand in lava, it is not indefinite though, so you'd better find land!
  • level 1 would add 2 seconds (17 sec overall), level 2 would add 7 seconds (22 sec overall), level 3 (the highest) 15 seconds added (30 sec overall)

However this is ALL subject to change if mojang accepts this idea.

The Advantages:

  • 1) Adding a way of safety when someone falls into lava, all you have to do is take your pants and boots off, equip these moccasins and vwualah  you've escaped impending doom. 
  • 2) This would add a balance to the overworlds "special armor" as well as The Ends "special armor" (the elytra) and allow more exploration and intrigue into making armor and choosing your sets.
  • 3)In the building community this would allow easier maneuverability in the Nether for builds on lava lakes.
  • 4)It can be crafted from things you can already find in the nether, therefore requiring a little bit of exploration, adventure, and a bit of risk.

The Disadvantages:

  • 1)It is weaker than diamond and netherite armor so you are more vulnerable to attacks.
  • 2)With the factor of being protected from lava for a limited time, when the time runs out the moccasins burn up in the lava when you die.
  • 3)Since they are made from leather they're durability is not the best, the only way to remedy this is unbreaking and mending.
New item, moving to correct category.
it is not that helpful, a potion of fire resistance would do better.
This could be made on the loom possibly alongside other leather items and I think to make these moccasins it should use Strider string as thread to keep the leather pieces together.

I think it would be batter to just make a pair of boots that could float on lava, with the drawback that while you would stay on top of the lava, you would still take fire damage. then you would still have to use existing potions, but it would make building I the nether a lot easier

I think it would be batter to just make a pair of boots that could float on lava, with the drawback that while you would stay on top of the lava, you would still take fire damage. then you would still have to use existing potions, but it would make building in the nether a lot easier

The reasoning behind the short fire resistance time: is yes you could just use a fire resistance potion, when you use the turtle shell you dont need it cause you can just use a water breathing potion, but the reason for having the turtle shell is because of the benefit of not having to use your resources/waste them in order to save yourself a little longer underwater time.

  • The main benefit of the moccasins is the fact that they allow you to be more maneuverable, as well as the potential for a wider spectrum of armor choices, for example (again) the turtle shell or elytra are just an expanded version of whats already in the game (levitation/slow falling/ender pearls basically ways to "fly", and water breathing).

It would be far to out of balance for the game to introduce an item that gives you permanent fire resist aswell as increased speed while in lava, there needed to be a counter balance so that this Item is not over powered, thus the short fire resist time, I have also included the option to increase the time you have fire resist(if mojang sees it fit to add it)

I think it should allow you to walk on lava, but very slowly, like you're sinking in soul sand. The moccasins shouldn't let you burn if they keep you afloat on the lava - after all, the striders don't burn.

This wouldn't eliminate the use for fire resistance, as you still can't enter the lava to search for ancient debris
It could slowly sink in the lava if you don't move with them and once the lava gets up to a certain level on your body, you start to burn normally
I would call them Basalt Boots. They should look like knee-length high-heels, just for funsies
No, I would prefer something that allows you to actually walk on lava.
are you high?
This would make diamonds farmable and not be good for the game
Sand is soft
That would be crazy op
I have a better idea: When breaking cactus with hand damage is taken, but when breaking it with tools no damage is taken.
